bill_title: revise certain provisions concerning the publication of facsimile ballot.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions concerning the publication of facsimile ballot. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-13-13 be amended to read as follows: 9-13-13. A notice of each municipal election shall be published once each week for two successive weeks, the first publication may not be less than ten days prior to the election. A facsimile of the official ballot shall be published at least four days in the calendar week prior to each election. The notice and ballot shall be published in the official newspaper or newspapers of the municipality as designated in § 9-12-6. If no newspaper is published in the municipality, the notice shall also be posted in three of the most public places in the municipality. Section 2. That § 12-16-16 be amended to read as follows: 12-16-16. The county auditor shall publish in each official newspaper of the county, facsimiles of the official ballots of every each election in which the voters of the entire county participate. The facsimile shall be published once in each legal newspaper at least four days in the calendar week prior to each election. The newspaper shall receive for the publications, compensation at the same rate as the general display rate for the newspaper. The published facsimile may be reduced in size proportionately up to fifty percent but in no case may the ballot wording be in a type less than eight point. If a portion of a candidate ballot is not voted on in the entire county, a facsimile of that portion of the ballot may be published simultaneously but separate from the candidate ballot and shall contain a description of who will vote on that portion of the ballot. If a portion of a ballot is blank, that portion does not need to be printed. Section 3. That § 13-7-8 be amended to read as follows: 13-7-8. The business manager of the school district shall publish in the official newspaper notices of an election once each week for two consecutive weeks with the first publication not less than ten days before the election. The notice shall state the date of the coming school election, the vacancies to be filled with terms of each, the candidates who have filed for these vacancies, questions, if any, to be submitted at the election, and the location of polling places. A facsimile of the official ballot shall be published at least four days in the calendar week prior to each election.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions concerning the publication of facsimile ballot. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-13-13 be amended to read as follows: 9-13-13. A notice of each municipal election shall be published once each week for two successive weeks, the first publication may not be less than ten days prior to the election. A facsimile of the official ballot shall be published at least four days in the calendar week prior to each election. The notice and ballot shall be published in the official newspaper or newspapers of the municipality as designated in § 9-12-6. If no newspaper is published in the municipality, the notice shall also be posted in three of the most public places in the municipality. Section 2. That § 12-16-16 be amended to read as follows: 12-16-16. The county auditor shall publish in each official newspaper of the county, facsimiles of the official ballots of every each election in which the voters of the entire county participate. The facsimile shall be published once in each legal newspaper at least four days in the calendar week prior to each election. The newspaper shall receive for the publications, compensation at the same rate as the general display rate for the newspaper. The published facsimile may be reduced in size proportionately up to fifty percent but in no case may the ballot wording be in a type less than eight point. If a portion of a candidate ballot is not voted on in the entire county, a facsimile of that portion of the ballot may be published simultaneously but separate from the candidate ballot and shall contain a description of who will vote on that portion of the ballot. If at least fifty percent of a ballot is blank, the blank portion does not need to be printed. No political advertising may appear on the same page as the facsimile ballot. Section 3. That § 13-7-8 be amended to read as follows: 13-7-8. The business manager of the school district shall publish in the official newspaper notices of an election once each week for two consecutive weeks with the first publication not less than ten days before the election. The notice shall state the date of the coming school election, the vacancies to be filled with terms of each, the candidates who have filed for these vacancies, questions, if any, to be submitted at the election, and the location of polling places. A facsimile of the official ballot shall be published at least four days in the calendar week prior to each election.
